meanings.definition: A piece of material attached to a hat or cap to cover and protect the ears.
meanings.sent1: The fluffy earlaps on the winter hat kept my ears warm.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the earlaps on her cap before heading out into the cold.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tugged on the earlaps of the hat, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: The earlaps of the hat were like cozy blankets hugging my ears from the chilly wind.
meanings.sent5: The bright red earlaps stood out against the white snow, making the hat easy to spot.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect the ears with earlaps.
meanings.sent1: I earlapped my head with a scarf to shield my ears from the biting wind.
meanings.sent2: He always earlaps his ears with earmuffs when he goes skiing.
meanings.sent3: The child playfully earlapped his friend's ears with his hands during the game.
meanings.sent4: She earlapped her ears with her hands to muffle the loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The mother lovingly earlapped her child's ears with a soft blanket to keep them warm.
